content.description: The crux is in the final half, so take it easy as you stem your way up between the columns. At the fifth bolt, continue up (Naiad trends right) into steeper terrain. Keep it together--the final half requires a good combination of power and endurance.

Another very fun route with movement unlike that found at the other crags along the South Fork corridor. Naiad and Proboscis start together and diverge at the fifth bolt.

Navigate a series of steep bulges on positive holds to an excellent rest. Don't celebrate too soon--the business is at the top!
content.location: Same start as Proboscis, trending right after fifth bolt.

content.description:
One of the finest routes in Southeast Idaho, Esoteric is long, steep, and action-packed from ground to chains. Start in the obvious gray streak, stem up between columns, and into the cave. Save some energy! The finish is a series of dynamic throws on big holds requiring power and plenty of endurance. An area classic, for sure.

60 meter rope necessary.
content.location: Third bolted route from left on lower ledge.
